Message: What should a free bird do...?

I can’t think of anything...
Anything at all...
After all, I have nothing left...

Ah... I never got to thank
Miss Aura or her friend...

Yeah... I should go thank them.
I can tell them how peaceful
the last years of Gran’s
life were, too...

But, as soon as I left
the forest behind,
I heard a rumor—

With heavy steps,
I headed for where she was
said to have been laid to rest—
“The City of Graves.”

In the seemingly endless cemetery,
standing beside Miss Aura’s casket
was the witch that had once
traveled with her, rapier in hand.

Just as I approached to greet her,
she pointed the tip
of her blade at my neck.

“Have you come here to
disturb the dead as well?”

Her cold tone sent
a chill up my spine,
so I quickly shouted—

“I-I came to leave
some flowers for her!”

The witch’s breath caught,
and she lowered her sword,
which had begun to
tremble slightly.

When I peered up at her face,
she was crying.
